item.title: Odds of winning constant probability games against one person
item.description: Probabilities and games. Two simple games used to illustrate certain features of calculating probabilities are as follows: You and a friend take turns flipping a fair coin. The first person to flip heads wins. If you go first, what are your chances of winning? You and a friend take turns rolling a fair die with 6 sides. The first person to roll a 6 wins. If you go first, what are your chances of winning.
